definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 認人|认人[ren4 ren2]

sentences.english: She seems like a kook, but she is just grand, really.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去有点儿怪，不过她确实是个好人儿。

sentences.english: In the centre of the round table, on a circular glass stand, were some little china figures.
sentences.chinese: 原来在圆桌中央的玻璃圆托盘里摆着几个小瓷人儿。

sentences.english: Over the years, the creature (fortune you experienced?
sentences.chinese: 苦命的人儿，这些年你都经历了什么？

sentences.english: She is a beauty without peer.
sentences.chinese: 她是天下无双的美人儿。

sentences.english: There was in him a headstrong little man who hated Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 在他心里早就有个憎恨拿破仑的顽固小人儿了。

sentences.english: Lauren is the apple of my eye.
sentences.chinese: 劳伦这姑娘是我心中理想的人儿。

sentences.english: A man is vaguely aware of some short people living in the house。
sentences.chinese: 男人模模糊糊地知道和一些小人儿们住在一起。

sentences.english: People who are in love are happy people.
sentences.chinese: 沉浸爱河的人们总是幸福的人儿。

sentences.english: Those in the Garden will be attended by immortal youths with wide, lovely eyes.
sentences.chinese: 乐园里的这些人将由永远青春的大眼美人儿伺候。

sentences.english: The child was in flood of tears .
Guan million, landscape with acacia, one at the end of the world.
sentences.chinese: 关山万里，山水重重，相思的人儿在天涯。

sentences.english: Aunt Norris lives too far off to think of such little people as you.
sentences.chinese: 诺里斯姨妈离我们太远了，不会想到你这样的小人儿。

sentences.english: The show was talking about "Mother's day".
sentences.chinese: 一会小人儿站起来说，今天是妈妈的天。

sentences.english: All at once, she burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 突然她哭得象个泪人儿似的。

sentences.english: So heed, here, when you awaken, what Isay.
sentences.chinese: 所有在世的人儿啊，请留心倾听我的言语。

sentences.english: These drawer-dropping beauties in skintight leather trousers.
sentences.chinese: 这些让人血脉贲张的美人儿穿着性感的紧身皮裤。

definition: erhua variant of 女孩[nu:3 hai2]
pleasant/agreeable/a person after one's heart (charming person)/a gifted person
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
mythological daughter of Fiery Emperor 炎帝[Yan2 di4] who turned into bird Jingwei 精衛|精卫[Jing1 wei4] after drowning
erhua variant of 男孩[nan2 hai2]
fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
